description: {"blocks":[{"key":"apvhv","text":"Massively parallel, second-generation short-read DNA sequencing has become an integral tool in biology for genomic studies. Offering highly accurate base-pair resolution at the most competitive price, the technology has become widespread. However, high-throughput generation of multiplexed DNA libraries can be costly and cumbersome. Here, we present a cost-conscious protocol for generating multiplexed short-read DNA libraries using a bead-linked transposome from Illumina. By preparing libraries in high-throughput with small reaction volumes that use 1/50th the amount of transposome compared to Illumina DNA Prep tagmentation protocols, the cost per library can be substantially reduced, by approximately 1/20th. Furthermore, we optimised the protocol to minimise magnetic bead-based clean-ups between steps, further reducing cost, time and DNA input requirements. By developing our own dual index primers to multiplex nine 96-well microplates, up to 864 samples can be placed on a single flow cell. This enables efficient usage of large-scale sequencing platforms, such as the Illumina NovaSeq 6000, which offers up to three terabases of sequencing per S4 flow cell.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":559,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":714,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"35gam","text":"This protocol is designed for Illumina short-read sequencing and requires previously purified DNA. The DNA will be diluted, tagmented and later amplified, thus only a small input is needed, approximately 3 ng. To aid conducting this protocol, program files for automated workstations by PerkinElmer have been provided in the supplemental with descriptions and compatible hardware. Helpful excel sheets to create standard curves for DNA quantification and dilution strategies are also provided. Lastly, custom dual index primers are provided to multiplex nine unique 96-well microplates, enabling multiplexing up to 864 samples on a single sequencing run.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a647h","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v187","text":"  ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"62ij9","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"6E436B80057811EDB7254D70CE7F98EB","id":269568,"original_name":"supplemental.zip","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihia222e.zip"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5t2ld","text":"To measure a 96-well microplate of DNA samples with a dsDNA quantification high sensitivity kit (for microplate reader) (BioDynami or Thermo Fisher Scientific), ensure concentrations are ≤ 33 ng/µL. For instance, first quantify a few samples on a Qubit Fluorometer. Highly concentrated microplates of DNA can be diluted 1/10 before starting (e.g. 5 µL of DNA added to 45 µL nuclease-free water in a new 96-well microplate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gtuc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7rn14","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":162,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bof3k","text":"dsDNA quantification high sensitivity kits have a quantification range of 0.2 to 100 ng. This protocol will quantify 3 µL of DNA at a concentration of ≤ 33 ng/µL.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"57vtm","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":175,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5111v","text":"Highly concentrated samples are difficult to measure on microplate readers. Reducing gain on fluorescent microplate reader to 80% can help but will be at the cost of accuracy.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63tnc","text":"For each 96-well microplate of DNA samples, prepare two microplates suitable for a fluorescent microplate reader. As standards will need to be read in addition to samples, the orginal 96-well microplate of samples will need to be split across two microplates (label as microplate A and B, or 1-48 and 49-96 etc). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8orfv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df71n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"76gc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":123,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"c2sgq","text":"Example microplates are listed in the materials. These plates can be washed, stored and re-used for future quantifications.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9r04","text":"Transfer 97 µL of quantification working solution into the first two columns of each microplate (16 wells each microplate). This will be used for 8 standards, done in duplicate on each microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3unh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vuhn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cqrsd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":100,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"c1n","text":"Having standards on each microplate is necessary for accuracy when generating standard curves later.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evh65","text":"Add 3 µL of each DNA sample to the microplate columns dedicated to samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jq6l","text":"Add 3 µL of each standard to the microplate columns dedicated to standards. Perform this in duplicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97huj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f72f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1u8j6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":113,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"a18ai","text":"Add standards in increasing concentration: 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10 ng/µL. Then duplicate in the next column.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d1jc","text":"Seal the microplate with adhesive film, vortex and briefly spin down. Incubate for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crr7c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"23kpe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":103,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"6d5lc","text":"The fluorescence signal is stable for approximately 3 h at room temperature, when protected from light.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqph6","text":"Ensure the diluted samples are mixed and briefly spin down if necessary. Can be sealed with adhesive film and stored at -20°C until ready for tagmentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2vlu","text":"Add 4 µL of a 2.5 µM i5 index primer and 4 µL of a 2.5 µM i7 index primer to each sample. Ensure each well has a unique combination of dual index primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn8mc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hikv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5nqq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":284,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bf8bq","text":"Eight unique i5 index primers will need to be arrayed horizontally, across the eight rows of the microplate (one i5 index for a whole row). Twelve unique i7 index primers will need to be arrayed vertically, down the twelve columns of the microplate (one i7 index for a whole column). ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7d9ul","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":90,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"b632e","text":"Dual index primer sequences and recommended combinations are provided in the supplemental.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"359hn","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":262,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5iai7","text":"This step can be prone to human error. Ensure tubes are labelled and microplate orientations are accounted for (e.g. include blanks in decipherable locations per microplate). Using an automated workstation such as a JANUS G3 (PerkinElmer) is highly recommended. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fek78","text":"Transfer 5 µL of tagmentation reaction (template) from the 384-well microplate to the 96-well microplate containing the PCR master mix aliquots. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vbde","text":"Seal microplate with adhesive film (PCR-grade), vortex and briefly centrifuge (avoid pelleting the beads). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sjli","text":"72°C for 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30g8g","text":"98°C for 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ptck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c7lo","text":"12-16 cycles of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2tqk","text":"98°C for 45 s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rfhk","text":"62°C for 30 s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af3ce","text":"72°C for 2 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3dbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18h8i","text":"72°C for 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4el81","text":"Hold at ≤ 10°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d85f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpr27","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fnm5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqeo4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":183,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"c53n","text":"Avoid high number of PCR cycles to limit duplicate fragments and formation of hetero-duplexes. Currently we have been regularly using 16 cycles however believe it can now be reduced. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9lnjh","text":"Proceed to pooling or store at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aaqdr","text":"Quantify the DNA libraries as previously described, using a dsDNA quantification high sensitivity kit for microplate reader (BioDynami or Thermo Fisher Scientific), or a Qubit Fluorometer for low-throughput samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2so1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rua","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5p95n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":184,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"3dola","text":"Optional, but this helps provide a more uniform pooling of samples. Pooling samples based on concentration asssumes samples have a similar average insert size; true molarity may vary. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6mflm","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":175,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"cbh9f","text":"To measure molarity, use a high sensitive automated electrophoresis system, such as LabChip GX devices (PerkinElmer) or Bioanalyzer/TapeStation devices (Agilent Technologies).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k840","text":"Add 40 µL of nuclease-free water into 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube to start the pool. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dubu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6nerm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":56,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4rm0a","text":"Optional, but this is ideal for automated workstations. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5oqp","text":"Transfer an equal amount of each library (based on concentration, molarity or use a set volume e.g. 10 µL) from each well of the microplate into the same 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube. This can be performed on an automated workstation (e.g. JANUS G3 by PerkinElmer), providing a csv file with volumes to transfer for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmtqg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i65g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bsfkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":46,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"cs3i0","text":"10 µL x 96 samples + initial 40 µL = 1,000 µL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7l2r","text":"To perform a stringent size selection, a PippinHT (Sage Science) can be used. This will remove undesirable shorter fragments that will have overlapping sequencing on paired-end platforms. Using a PippinHT, perform an automatic size selection and gel purification, following the manufacturer’s instructions (Sage Science). A 2% agarose casette and reagents are ideal for Illumina short-read libraries. A size selection of 430 - 600 bp is ideal for Illumina 150 bp paired-end sequencing, but will depend on sequencing platform and the quantity of pooled libary required. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u83u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6corc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj7ev","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":290,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5fvqm","text":"The PippinHT has 12 lanes, markers can be internal (recommended) or external. Each lane requires 20 µL of DNA combined with 5 µL of marker. The manufacturer recommends a maximum 1.5 µg per lane. We have often overloaded to 3 µg per lane with minimal to no consequence to the size selection.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"49dh9","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":187,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"eletr","text":"Note the dual index primers and tagmentation adapters add 136 bp to the amplified library length, therefore library sizes approximately 436 bp are ideal for 150 bp paired-end sequencing. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dh1hc","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":164,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"as2vm","text":"The higher the stringency of the size selection, the lower the recovery of library. Have a wider size selection range to recover more library (e.g. 350 - 1,000 bp).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j0g2","text":"Prior to PippinHT size selection, the library may need to be concentrated, which can be done with AMPure XP beads (or equivalent) according to the manufacturer's inctructions (Beckman Coulter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmfo1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"l3e6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":152,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fdumg","text":"Alternatively, to concentrate large pools of library, use a MinElute PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen 28004), according to the manufacturer's inctructions. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eno9i","text":"After PippinHT size selection, the library can be cleaned and concentrated with AMPure XP beads (or equivalent) according to the manufacturer's inctructions (Beckman Coulter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"at8bq","text":"Perform a quality check analysis of the final library pool on a high sensitive automated electrophoresis system, such as LabChip GX devices (PerkinElmer) or Bioanalyzer/TapeStation devices (Agilent Technologies).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpb24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5goma","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1b3bb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":51,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"47sgj","text":"This can be done by your local sequencing facility.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ng1h","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":85,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"eavot","text":"It is good practice to include an aliquot from the raw (unclean) pool for comparison.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q37i","text":"Ensure the library looks as expected, relative to size selection and sequencing strategy. For Illumina NovaSeq 6000 150 bp paired-end sequencing, a library 400-600 bp is ideal. Estimate the average fragment length.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49lkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9til1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eb7iv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":254,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"f38t7","text":"A double peak is indicative of over-amplification; primers may become limited, PCR products may anneal, forming/amplifying fragments that are twice as large (such as hetero-duplexes). Quantification and calculation of molarity will likely not be precise.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"as5qk","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":293,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7b0gh","text":"A stretched peak, similar to a double peak, may form if the electrophoresis system is overloaded. This is referred to as ‘bird nesting’; the DNA fragments get intertwined and appear longer. This is not necessarily an issue; denaturation during sequencing bridge PCR will eliminate this tangle.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1oual","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":333,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"3bv56","text":"If the library size is very large (e.g. greater than 1 kb), there is not enough transposition occuring in the tagmentation reaction. Something may be inhibiting the tagmentation reaction if the DNA is highly contaminated. Alternatively, DNA input may have been too high; check the concentration and reduce the DNA input if necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cb6e","text":"Quantify the library at least twice with a Qubit Fluorometer, using a Qubit dsDNA high sensitivity assay kit. Determine the average of the readings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ih14","text":"Calculate molarity; nM = (ng/µL x 106) / (660 g/mol x average fragment size bp).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":36,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"air6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77o3a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72hpl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":189,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"48lku","text":"Although high sensitive automated electrophoresis systems will provide a molarity calculation, we have found molarity based on Qubit values and an average fragment length the most accurate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7uckl","text":"Dilute the library to a suitable molarity for sequencing. Store at -20°C until ready for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a48i0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7n57k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":138,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"40tre","text":"Most sequencing facilities will require libraries ~2-10 nM for Illumina platforms. Check with local sequencing provider before diluting.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgjvq","text":"Resuspend the Bead-Linked Transposome (BLT), thoroughly by flick-mixing and brief vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fn2c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2it0h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":38,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":24,"style":"sup"}],"key":"ei2qn","text":"BLT is from the Illumina DNA Prep Kit.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6vs7","text":"Place the tube on a magnetic rack for 5 min, or until all beads pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jeq2","text":"Keeping the tube on the magnetic rack, transfer the supernatant to a new tube, without disturbing the beads. The beads can be discarded. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jhk5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8j0nt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":149,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"cjlhi","text":"These steps are only necessary when using the bead-linked transposome (BLT). The amplified library is free in solution and not attached to the beads.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ds15","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":234,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"34th6","text":"It is good practice to save an aliquot (e.g. 10 µL) of the pool for QC analysis on a high sensitive automated electrophoresis systems, such as LabChip GX devices (PerkinElmer) or Bioanalyzer/TapeStation devices (Agilent Technologies).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7si52","text":"Transfer 97 µL of quantification working solution into the microplates for half of the the DNA samples. For example, filling columns 4-9 on microplate A, and 5-10 on microplate B, as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17jgi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsqog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj2g7","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9ct6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2cin7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f23i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66AA5CD0033E11EDBE8F2B267983BB25","height":125,"id":269570,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"map_plate_2_crop.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihie222e.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihic222e.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihid222e.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ihib222e.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":395,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"a88he","text":"It is good practice to be able to distinguish the two microplates from one another to avoid confusion and/or mistakes. Here, microplate A will have columns 1-2 as standards, column 3 as blank, columns 4-9 as DNA samples. Microplate B will have two columns as blank between the standards and DNA samples. For instance: columns 1-2 as standards, columns 3-4 as blank, columns 5-10 as DNA samples. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qm6d","text":"Quantify the DNA samples. For a low-throughput number of samples, quantify with a Qubit Fluorometer according to the manufacturer's instructions (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The following describes quantification in high-throughput (96-well microplates) by reading on a fluorescent microplate reader. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d54q","text":"Send for sequencing, on ice, cold packs or dry ice depending on the distance to the closest sequencing facility.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"659q6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1v7j4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":107,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8ekm7","text":"The Illumina NovaSeq 6000 is recommended, using a flowcell with 300 cycles (150 bp paired-end sequencing). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vbml","text":"The pooled library can now undergo clean-up and size selection, which is flexible and multiple methods exist. For example, use AMPure XP Reagent (SPRI paramagnetic beads) according to the manufacturer's instructions (Beckman Coulter). Typically, 0.5-1x of the beads are addded relative to the total volume of the pool.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fct8i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bl5g1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":215,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"e6o1f","text":"As the beads provided in the Illumina DNA prep tagmentation sample kit havent been consumed by the protocol, they could be used here following the manufacturer's instructions, by adjusting for the different volume. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9r67n","text":"It may be necessary to repeat the clean-up to remove all primers and short fragments from the pool. For example a second 0.6x AMPure XP size selection according to the manufacturer's inctructions (Beckman Coulter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
